Open01 Technical Service Agreement

Last Updated: [December 1, 2016]

Preface & Introduction

These Open01 Technical Service Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the “Agreement”) is a service agreement between you and Open01 Technical Limited. (hereinafter referred to as the “Company”). CAMPASS (hereinafter referred to as the “Service”) is an enterprise-level data service provided by the Company. From the date when you accept the Agreement, the Agreement becomes effective and binding upon you and the Company.

The Agreement is entered into by and between you and the Company. You assert that you are natural person, legal person or other organization that has full capacity for civil right, and capacity for civil conduct, and can independently bear the civil liabilities when you agree to accept this Agreement and register as the user of CAMPASS; if you are legally authorized to conclude this Agreement for and on behalf of a company or other legal entities, then it is implied that you declare that you have the right to bind upon such entities and its affiliates to theses terms and conditions; in this case, the term “you” refer to such entities and its affiliates. The clauses hereof are not be excluded by the laws of your country or region. If you do not have such authority, or you disagree with these terms and conditions, please do not accept the Agreement nor use the Service.

If you are our direct rival, without our prior written authorization, you shall not use the Service. If you are not our direct rival, without our prior written authorization, you shall not use the Service to assist our direct rivals to monitor the availability, performance or functions of the Service, or for any other comparison purposes.


Article 1 Acceptance of the Agreement

1. You confirm that before the Service ID is created and used, you have read and agreed to comply with the Agreement and other agreement documents implied by the Agreement. You shall carefully read and fully understand all terms and conditions hereof, in particular clauses regarding exceptions or limitation of liability, jurisdiction and governing law, and separate agreements concerning opening or use of certain service. Limitation of liability and exception clauses may be highlighted in bold or underlined for your special attention.

2. You agree that once you click any boxes indicating acceptance or sign the purchase orders mentioning the Agreement or use the Service, you agree to accept and comply with all terms and conditions of the Agreement. Unless you have read and accepted all terms and conditions hereof, you have no right to use the services of the Agreement. Your use of the Agreement indicates that you have read and agree to be bound by the Agreement.

3. You agree that the Company has the right to unilaterally alter all or part of terms and conditions hereof based on the Company’s business arrangement at any time. After the Agreement is altered, the Company will make an announcement on the webpage. Once the altered agreement is published on the webpage, the altered agreement will effectively supersede the original service terms and conditions without further notice; if you continue using the Service after announcement, it is implied that you have fully read, understood and accepted the altered agreement contents, and will use the Service in accordance with the altered terms and conditions; if you disagree with the altered terms and conditions, you shall stop using the Service.


Article 2 Scope of the Agreement

The Agreement shall also contain the Privacy Policy (linkage website: www.campass.open01.com) and the Open01 Technical Software License Agreement (linkage website: www.campass.open01.com). Once the aforesaid contents are formally published, such contents are an integral part of the Agreement, and you shall also comply with such contents.


Article 3 Contents of the Service

The Company provides the registered users with the data services via CAMPASS of which the intellectual property rights are owned by the Company. Please visit www.campass.open01.com for the introduction to the products and relevant services provided by the Company.


Article 4 Service ID

1. Before using the Service, you must register and obtain the Service ID assigned by the Company to you for CAMPASS (hereinafter referred to as “ID”). You agree and warrant that:

(1) All user’s information submitted according to the service requirements of CAMPASS is true, accurate, complete and timely, and is free from any misleading or false representations, and you warrant that the Company could contact with you through your contact information;

(2) You undertake to timely update your user’s information and maintain the validity of such information;

(3) If your data or information contains any inaccurate and unreal information, the Company reserves the right to cancel your ID, revoke your eligibility for use and terminate the services to you at any time;

(4) If you register in the capacity of representative or agent for and on behalf of an company or other legal entities, you must provide the details and information and the written authorization documents of the agent and the client. If you do not furnish the aforesaid materials, information and documents to the Company, the Company will regard the registering person as the user;

(5) You shall keep your CAMPASS ID properly. Only you could use your CAMPASS ID. This ID is non-transferable, non-assignable and non-inheritable.

2. The Company hereby especially reminds you that you shall keep your ID and password properly. You shall be solely liable for all operation and comments made via this ID and password. The Company identifies your instructions via your ID and password. You shall be solely liable for any and all losses caused by disclose of password.

3. If you find that others illegally use or steal your ID and password, or find any other acts without legal authorization, you shall inform the Company in effective form immediately and request the Company to suspend the relevant services. The Company will take action timely after receipt of your request. You understand that it takes some time for the Company to take actions against your request. Before that, the Company will not be liable for any losses caused to you by any behaviors of your ID.


Article 5 Your Rights and Obligations

1. You have the right to possess your own CAMPASS ID and password, and have the right to visit CAMPASS website at any time via your own ID and password.

2. You have the right to receive the data services provided by CAMPASS, and have the right to obtain the Company’s technical support, consulting and other services at the same time. Please visit www.campass.open01.com for the detailed introductions to the relevant products and services.

3. You shall pay the service fees to the Company on time according to the Agreement.

4. You shall not (1) disclose to the public or publish the service interface provided by the platform, offer services similar to the Service, or sell any services or contents provided by the platform in any manner or substantially, or incorporate any services or contents in the service institution or outsource the services; (2) save or transmit any infringing, defamation or other illegal and unlawful materials, or save or transmit any materials infringing the privacy of any third party via the Service; (3) save or transmit malicious code via the Service; (4) disturb or damage the integrity or performance of any services or third-party data; (5) attempt to access to any services, contents or relevant systems or networks in authorized manner; (6) permit direct or indirect access to or use of any services or contents by avoiding the quantitative limitation specified by contracts; (7) duplicate the Service or any portion, features, functions or user’s interface of the Service; (8) duplicate any contents, except otherwise permitted by the Agreement or purchase orders or documents; (9) duplicate any portion of any services or contents in the form of framing or mirroring, unless otherwise framing in your own internal network, or permitted in documents; (10) access to any services or contents for acquisition or establishment of competitive products or services; or (11) engage in reverse engineering of any services (to the extent permitted by the restriction clause under laws).

You shall be solely and fully liable for breach of the aforesaid provisions. Meanwhile, the Company shall have the right to immediately terminate the Service without any refunds, and you shall be liable for indemnity for any losses caused to the Company thereby.

5. Without prior written consent of the Company, you shall not assign or transfer any rights and obligations hereunder to any third-party. If you breach the aforesaid provision, the Company shall have the right to terminate the Service forthwith without any refunds, and you shall be liable for indemnity for any losses caused to the Company thereby.

6. You represent and warrant that you have the proper and lawful rights in the uploaded or published information. Otherwise, the Company may delete or shield your uploaded or published information according to laws or the Agreement, without further notice.

7. Once other information and data than personal information furnished and published by you via this platform are uploaded or published, you shall irrecoverably grant the Company a free license to use the aforesaid information and data during the copyright protection period. You agree that the Company could save, use, duplicate, revise, compile and translate your aforesaid information and data, or produce other derivatives, or publish, display and distribute the aforesaid information and data after desensitization of the sensitive information, and incorporate the aforesaid information and data in other works in the form, media or technology that has been known or will be developed in the future for the purpose of providing and improving the Service, and other relevant services of the Company.

8. In order to facilitate you to use other relevant services of the Company, you authorize the Company to transfer the information provided and formed in your registration of ID and use of the Service to other relevant service providers of the Company, or obtain any information provided and formed in your registration and use of the relevant services from other relevant service providers of the Company.

9. You shall be solely and fully liable for all consequences arising from inaccurate contact information furnished by you to the Company, and the poor security and stability of the e-mail address to receive CAMPASS mails, including but not limited to consequences and losses arising from your failure to receive the relevant notices of CAMPASS in time.

10. You shall respect the intellectual property rights and other lawful rights of the Company and other third parties, and shall warrant that you will do your best to protect the Company and its shareholders, employees and partners from and against influence or losses of illegal events that infringe the aforesaid rights and interest when such events take place; the Company reserves the right to terminate the Service without any refunds when you infringe the legitimate rights and interest of CAMPASS.

11. You undertake that you will not engage in any events that probably affect operation of the Service or the reputation, rights and interest of the Company in use of the Service.

12. When you use the Service, you shall comply with the national and local laws, regulations, industry practice and social public morality, and shall not engage in any illegal and unlawful activities via the Service, including but not limited to:

(1) Publish, transmit, communicate and save any contents that jeopardize national security and unity, damage social stability, violate public order and good custom, insult, slander, contain obscene and violent information, or otherwise violate the national laws and regulations;

(2) Publish, transmit, communicate and save contents that infringe the intellectual property rights, trade secrets and other lawful rights of others;

(3) Maliciously forge the facts and conceal the truth to mislead and cheat others;

(4) Publish, transmit and communicate the advertising information and junk information;

(5) Other behaviors prohibited by the laws and regulations. Meanwhile, you shall warrant that you will not offer any convenience for others to publish the aforesaid information and contents that violate the national regulations and/or the Agreement, including but not limited to setup of URL and BANNER links. If you violate this article, the relevant national organs or bodies might institute legal proceedings against you, impose fine or take other sanction measures, and demand the Company to offer assistance. In case of damages, you shall give compensations according to laws, and the Company will not assume any liabilities. If the Company finds that or receipt whistle-blowing from others that your published information violates this article, the Company has the right to make independent judgment and take technical means to delete and shield such information or disconnect the linkage. Meanwhile, the Company shall also have the right to take such actions including but not limited to suspension or termination of the Service, limitation or termination of your ID, and investigation of legal liability, depending on the nature of the user’s behaviors. If you violate this article, resulting in losses to any third party, you shall solely assume all liabilities; meanwhile, you acknowledge that the Company has the right to terminate the Service without any refunds when you violate the aforesaid provisions. In case of any losses caused to the Company by your aforesaid behaviors, you shall be also liable for indemnity.


Article 6 Rights and Obligations of the Company

1. The Company is a legal corporate entity that is duly incorporated and validly exists in accordance with the Chinese laws, has the qualification to offer the Service hereunder, and is capable of providing you with the services according to this Agreement.

2. The Company shall provide you with the eligible network technology and information services based on your service option and payment status.

3. The Company shall have the right to verify your identity and decide whether to accept you as the Company’s user, or whether to make a deal with you. The Company and its affiliates shall have the right to use your materials and information at all websites of the Company and its affiliates.

4. The Company’s provision of the Service hereunder to you shall not be constructed as the Company’s granting in any way you any substantial rights or interest of any form other than the Service hereunder.

5. You agree to authorize the Company to use your business name and logo (if applicable) for the purpose of promotion, and disclosure of the cooperation relationship between both parties. The Company undertakes not to use your business name and logo beyond the aforesaid scope.

6. The Company has the right but is not obligated to review all contents published by all users at the website or forum. In respect of any contents that we hold disputable or might violate the Agreement, this article or any applicable laws and regulations, we reserve the right to compile these contents, refuse to publish and remove these contents.

7. The Company has the right to save, use, duplicate, revise, compile and translate your aforesaid information and data, or produce other derivatives, or publish, display and distribute after desensitization of the sensitive information other information and data than personal information that you provide and publish via this platform. Meanwhile, the Company has the right to transfer the information provided and formed in your registration of ID and use of the Service to other relevant service providers of the Company, or obtain any information provided and formed in your registration and use of the relevant services from other relevant service providers of the Company.


Article 7 Service Fee and Settlement

1. When you use the Service, the Company has the right to charge the service fees from you based on the corresponding service fee introduction, orders and/or relevant agreements. The specific service fees are subject to the charging announcement that is published at www.campass.open01.com or other written agreements between you and the Company when you use the Service.


Article 8 Intellectual Property Rights

1. Except otherwise especially stated, the intellectual property rights in all contents at the Company’s website, including but not limited to works, pictures, files, information, materials, website structure, website picture arrangement and website design, and contents provided by the Company in the Service (including but not limited to webpage, characters, pictures, videos, radios and charts) shall be legally owned by the Company, including but not limited to trademark rights, patents, copyrights and trade secrets.

2. Except otherwise especially stated, the copyrights, patents and other intellectual property rights in the software backed on which the Company provides the Service are owned by the Company.

3. The aforesaid intellectual property rights and any other intellectual property rights in the contents contained in the Service are protected by laws. Without written consent of the Company, no one shall use or create any relevant derivatives in any form, or use, modify, duplicate, propagate, alter, distribute, issue or publish any programs or contents of this website.


Article 9 Information Security and Confidentiality Obligation

1. Both parties shall establish information security protection mechanism in respect of technology and system, to prevent information from being disclosed. You shall be solely liable for all consequences and losses arising from disclosure or third-party capture of information due to your fault.

2. You shall be obligated to keep any Confidential Information involving the Company in the process of the Service confidential. Without written authorization of the Company, you shall not disclose such Confidential Information to any third party. Otherwise, you shall be solely liable for any and all losses caused by violation of the aforesaid provisions, whether directly or indirectly.

3. The Company undertake to take adequate and effective measures to protect and keep the information and data that you provide to the Company in connection with the Agreement confidential, to prevent such information from being disclosed. Without your consent, the Company shall not disclose your information to any third party, nor authorize any third party to use your information, unless:

(1) The Company may provide such information according to this Agreement or other service agreements, contracts and online clauses between you and the Company;

(2) The Company discloses such information for addressing the whistle-blowing events or proceedings;

(3) The Company provides such information to the third parties for the purpose of providing you with the products, services and information, including providing you with the products, services and information via the technology and services of the third parties;

(4) The Company discloses such information in order to take necessary reasonable actions to prevent serious illegal behaviors or whistle-blowing acts;

(5) The Company has to disclose such information according to the requirements of the administrative and juridical departments;

(6) The Company shall provide such information according to laws and regulations.

4. You have the responsibility to make backups for the data used in the Service by yourself. If your Service is terminated, the Company may permanently delete your data from the server, except otherwise specified by the laws and regulations. After the Service is terminated, the Company is not obligated to return the data to you.


Article 10 Protection of Privacy and Other Personal Information

1. The Company focuses a lot on protection of the user’s personal information. The Company will collect, use, save and share your personal information pursuant to the Agreement and the Privacy Policy (www.campass.open01.com). If the provisions regarding personal information protection hereof conflict with the aforesaid Privacy Policy, and the Agreement has not expressly set out personal information protection, the Privacy Policy shall prevail.

2. You have to complete some necessary information when you register ID or use the Service. If your information is incomplete or untrue, you will be unable to use the Service or you are restricted in use of the Service.

3. Generally, you could browse and modify your information at any time. However, considering information security and ID verification, you may not modify the initial registration information and other verification information provided at the time of registration.

4. The Company will establish a sound management system to protect your personal information through all kinds of security technologies and procedures, in order to prevent unauthorized access, use or disclosure of your personal information.

5. The Company will not transfer or disclose your personal information to any non-associated third party, unless otherwise: (1) specified by relevant laws and regulations, or the requirements of the court and government bodies; (2) required by the Service; (3) specified by the Agreement or other service agreements, contracts and online clauses between you and the Company; or (4) required for merger, separation, acquisition or asset transfer.

6. You agree to strictly comply with the relevant laws and regulations concerning use of information of natural person or corporate entities, and accept the services of the Company pursuant to the Agreement, and agree not to engage in any unlawful activities that infringe personal privacy, portrait or secrets. If you has to upload or save any information involving personal information and trade secrets to the Company’s platform, or analyze the data via the Company’s platform when you use the services of the Company, you undertake that you are legally and duly authorized by the information owner to submit the aforesaid information to the Company’s platform, and the authorization scope of such information owner can meet the Company’s identification behaviors and information use scope. You shall be solely liable for any and all consequences arising from your failure to obtain the legal authorization from the information owner.

7. You agree that you shall use the information strictly to the extent authorized by the information owner in the legal, reasonable and necessary principles when you use the Service. You shall solely assume all liabilities arising from your out-of-scope or illegal and unreasonable use of the information, and shall be liable for indemnity for any losses caused to the Company at the same time.


Article 11 Software-based Service

1. The Company provides data services to the registered users through CAMPASS in which the intellectual property rights are owned by the Company. CAMPASS is an Servicer based on “Open01 Technical Software” in which the intellectual property rights are exclusively owned by the Company. In respect of this software, the Company grants you a personal, non-transferable and non-exclusive license. You may use such software only for the purpose of access to or use of the Service. For any rules and requirements related to use of the software, you shall carefully read and comply with the relevant provisions of the Open01 Technical Software License Agreement (linkage address: www.campass.open01.com).


Article 12 Change, Interruption and Termination of Service

1. The Company may change the contents of the Service, and may also interrupt, suspend or terminate the Service.

2. In any of following circumstances, the Company shall have the right to interrupt or terminate the Service without further notice:

(1) You shall submit true information according to laws and regulations, but your furnished personal information is untrue or inconsistent with the registered information, and you are unable to provide reasonable supporting documents;

(2) You have violated the Agreement;

(3) As required by laws, regulations or competent departments;

(4) For the sake of security or other necessary circumstances.

3. The Company has the right to charge fees according to Article 7 hereof. If you fail to pay the fees in full on time, the Company has the right to interrupt, suspend or terminate the Service.


Article 13 Liability for Breach of Contract

1. Your direct or indirect breach of any clauses hereof, non-performance or untimely and inadequate performance of any due obligations hereunder shall constitute default.

2. If you use the Company’s services in violation of the requirements and covenants hereof, you shall be deemed as default, and shall assume all liabilities caused thereby. Meanwhile, the Company shall have the right to immediately terminate the Service without any refunds, and you shall also be liable for indemnifying the Company any and all losses caused thereby.

3. A party’s failure or delay in exercise or partial exercise of its rights shall not constitute waive of such rights; non-exercise of one right shall not be constructed as waiver of other rights. Should any provisions hereof be held invalid, the validity of other provisions shall not be affected, and shall remain in full force and effect.

4. Any service fees incurred before termination of the Agreement shall not be affected by termination of the Agreement, and termination of the Agreement shall not constitute waiver of claim against other default acts of the breaching party.

5. The Company reserves the right to terminate the Service and your ID in the event that you violate the national and local laws and regulations or the Agreement, and in no event shall the Company be liable for any indirect, accidental, special and consequent damages.


Article 14 Force Majeure and Other Exceptions

1. If it is impossible to fulfill the Agreement or achieve the operation objectives hereunder due to force majeure (including but not limited to fire, flood, earthquake, typhoon, natural disaster, changes to government laws, regulations and orders, operator’s technology and communication failure) or other events beyond control of the Company, the Company shall be relieved from any liabilities.

2. The Company is not liable for any damages when you are unable to use the services as the system does not work for the following reasons, including but not limited to:

(1) In the period of an announcement that system is closed down for maintenance;

(2) The telecommunication equipment breaks down and cannot transmit the data;

(3) The Company’s system does not work due to force majeure events such as typhoon, earthquake, tsunami, flood, power failure, war, terrorist attack, etc.; or

(4) The Service is interrupted or delayed due to hacker attach, technical adjustment or failure of telecommunication department, website updating and bank’s problems.

3. The Company’s services are furnished based on the existing technologies and conditions, and the Company’s services may be relied on a third-party cloud platform that is not controlled by the Company. The Company will make its best efforts to provide services to you and guarantee consistency and security of the services; however, the Company is unable to foresee and prevent legislation, technology and other risks at any time, including but not limited to service interruption, loss of data and other losses and risks caused by force majeure events, virus, hobbyhorse, hacker attack, unstable system, third-party service defects and government acts.

4. The partners of the Service shall be solely liable for the quality and contents of its services. This website may contain links of third-party websites and resources. The Company does not possess or control these websites and resources. Thus, the Company is independent of any liabilities arising from your access to the aforesaid third-party websites and resources. If you access to these third-party websites and resources, you agree to fully bear all risks.

5. The Company’s platform will only sort and analyze the data and information furnished by you according to the Agreement. As the Company is unable to guarantee the accuracy, authenticity and relevance of the data, the Company cannot guarantee absolute accuracy and validity of the analysis results and analysis reports. The Service provided by the Company to you in accordance with the Agreement shall not constitute the Company’s any opinions about you and/or any persons including your customers, whether express or implied. In no event shall the Company be legally liable for any decisions or actions made or taken by you and/or any persons including your customers based on the Company’s services.

6. You shall at your own discretion and at your own risk download or obtain any materials through use of the Service, and shall be fully liable for any damage to your computer or mobile phone system or lose of data caused by downloading of such materials.

7. To the extent permitted by laws, the Company shall not be liable for any indirect, punitive, special and derivative losses (including loss of business, loss of income, loss of profits, loss of using data or other economic benefits) arising from or in connection with the Agreement, whether breach of the Agreement (including breach of warranties) or at tort, even though the Company has been informed of possibility of such losses. In addition, even if the fundamental objectives of the exclusive relieves hereunder have not been achieved, the Company shall be also relieved from liability for the aforesaid losses.

8. Except otherwise specified herein, in no event shall the Company’s gross liability for damages hereunder exceed the total service fees charged from you.


Article 15 Jurisdiction and Governing Law

1. Effectiveness, execution, interpretation and dispute resolution of the Agreement shall be governed in accordance with the current laws of the People’s Republic of China. Any disputes between you and the Company shall be settled through negotiation. If negotiation fails, either party may lodge a lawsuit to the people’s court of jurisdiction in Chaoyang District, Beijing.

2. Should any provisions hereof become invalid or unenforceable for whatever reasons, the remaining provisions shall remain in force, and binding upon both parties

3. In case of any disputes or proceedings, except as matters in dispute, both parties shall continue exercising and fulfilling other rights and obligations hereunder.


Article 16 Miscellaneous

1. 1.All headings hereof are for convenience of reference, do not have any actual meanings, and cannot become basis for interpretation of the Agreement.

2. The Agreement shall be composed of terms and conditions hereof, other agreement documents implied by the Agreement and rules published at the Company’s website. Relevant terms may refer to each other. In case of inconsistency, the terms and conditions in this Agreement shall prevail.

3. Your understanding and recognition of the Agreement shall constitute your understanding and recognition of contents of all components of the Agreement. Once you use the Service, you and the Company will be bound by all components of the Agreement.
